title: WolframAlpha Periodic Table typeface
content:
link: [http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=periodic+table&lk=4&num=1](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414035329/http:/www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=periodic+table&lk=4&num=1 "http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=periodic+table&lk=4&num=1")

I'm interested in the typeface used or the atomic symbols in the image of the periodic table.
author: Presentable

comments.content: **[Prima Sans BT (Roman)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414035329/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Bitstream&ffam=PrimaSans%20BT%20-%20Roman&fid=7bce9e4fa15f273d3af0db13ed0455bd&fsize=48&text=Fe%20Co%20Ni%20Cu%20Zn%20Ga%20Ge%20Ru%20Rh%20Pd%20Ag%20W&wrap=2)** from Bitstream looks very close, but it's not an exact match (for example: /a is a bit different)
Domestos Sans by Gunter Schwarzmaier is also a pretty close match - although the capital M is slightly different; the i is also a bit different, as well.

Looks like something like **[Vera Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414035329/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/Bitstream-Vera-Sans)**/ [DejaVu Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414035329/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/DejaVu-Sans)/ [Prima Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414035329/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/prima-sans/). There may be a way to solve it. Click on "Download Page" bottom right, create a new account, download document as PDF then check the Fonts tab under File \> Properties ([Command/Ctrl]+D).
